data.title: A&R Worldwide Newsletter Vol. 809
data.meta_description: A&R Worldwide Newsletter: The latest Music Industry news curated by Sat Bisla and the A&R Worldwide Team since 1998.
data.text:
MUSEXPO 2024 TO HOST EXCLUSIVE PANEL

WITH NBCUNIVERSAL & UNIVERSAL PICTURES

PRESIDENT OF MUSIC & PUBLISHING AND ITS TEAM

SIMON COWELL LAUNCHES SYCO MUSIC

WITH UNIVERSAL MUSIC GROUP

Simon Cowell recently announced that he is teaming up with Universal Music Group to introduce a new music publishing enterprise. Cowell’s Syco Entertainment and Universal Music Publishing Group (UMPG) are co-launching Syco Publishing.

This newly unveiled venture will curate songwriters and catalogs that will be exclusively managed through UMPG, presenting avenues for collaboration across Cowell’s expansive media domain. Syco Publishing commences its journey with songwriters Lucy Spraggan and John Samuel Gerhart, along with a trove of hit catalog rights including Fifth Harmony, James Arthur, Camila Cabello, and Pharrell Williams collaborations.

The company boasts ownership of compositions by artists like Ed Sheeran, Machine Gun Kelly, Shawn Mendes, and more. In 2021, Syco Entertainment collaborated with UMG, RESHET 13, and Fremantle Media to grant the victor of The X Factor Israel’s fourth season a global recording contract with UMG Israel.

In 2022, acknowledging the changing landscape of music discovery through platforms like TikTok, Cowell’s Syco Entertainment collaborated with Republic Records, TikTok, and Samsung to unveil StemDrop, a creative avenue for musicians to share their compositions.

With a career rooted in music publishing, Cowell expressed his excitement about the deal and building this new music publishing company alongside Universal. Cowell also highlighted his vision and passion for working with songwriters and reiterated his objectives to elevate the success of the new partnership with UMPG.

IVAN CORNEJO SIGNS TO INTERSCOPE: Ivan Cornejo has inked a significant new deal with Interscope Records. At just 19, Cornejo has achieved a multi-Platinum career, initiated by his 2021 debut album Alma Vacia. Praised by the New York Times as one of the year’s finest albums, it surged to number two on the Billboard Regional Mexican charts. Cornejo’s prolificacy shone through two 2022 releases: Triste and the seven-track album Dañado, which topped the Regional Mexican album charts and broke into Billboard’s Top 200 albums chart. John Janick, Chairman & CEO, Interscope Geffen A&M praised Cornejo’s cultural impact and artistry, expressing anticipation for the next phase of his exceptional career. Nir Seroussi, Interscope’s Executive VP overseeing Latin music, echoed this sentiment, heralding Cornejo’s songwriting prowess and live brilliance. His recent single “Aquí Te Espero” has further fortified his reputation, followed by a sold-out Chicago show and a fervent Lollapalooza Festival appearance. Having surpassed 1.1 billion streams, Cornejo’s presence continues to surge, marked by six nominations at the 2023 Premio Lo Nuestro Awards and wins at the 2022 Billboard Latin Music Awards.

SONY MUSIC STRIKES GLOBAL DEAL WITH INDIA’S BIG BANG MUSIC: Indian record label Big Bang Music has struck a significant global publishing deal with Sony Music Publishing (SMP). Through this partnership, SMP will handle the administration and promotion of Big Bang’s songs on a global scale. Big Bang Music is known as a modern music platform focused on discovering new independent music stars. This collaboration highlights the growing influence of India’s indie music scene and the increasing demand for its talent worldwide. The deal is expected to boost artists’ and songwriters’ publishing and royalty earnings while opening up opportunities for sync placements and global collaborations. The agreement encompasses administration, synchronization, and catalog promotion for Big Bang Music’s repertoire. Established in 2019 as a joint venture between Sony Music and management company KWAN, Big Bang Music was founded by its CEO Gaurav Wadhwa.

WARNER MUSIC CENTRAL EUROPE NAMES NEW SWISS GM: Warner Music Central Europe has announced that Hansjürg Stämpfli has been appointed General Manager of Warner Music Switzerland, with immediate effect. In his new role, he will be responsible for overseeing the company’s business in Switzerland and will report directly to Marcus Friedheim, Managing Director of Warner Music Central Europe. Hansjürg Stämpfli joined Warner Music as Brand Manager in October 2015 and was promoted to Senior Marketing Manager in April 2019. Before Warner Music, he worked for PwC in Switzerland for four years and studied Business Administration at the University of Bern. Hansjürg Stämpfli succeeds Stefania Lorenzetto, who was previously General Manager for Warner Music Switzerland.

CMG/MOTOWN RECORDS ANNOUNCE GLASS WINDOW DEAL: Capitol Music Group (CMG) / Motown Records and Glass Window Entertainment (founded by rapper Lil Baby) have announced a partnership. Rylo Rodriguez, the inaugural signee under Glass Window Entertainment/Motown Records, recently raced up the charts with the single, “Been One,” reaching into the Billboard 200’s top 10. Michelle Jubelirer, Chair & CEO, Capitol Music Group highlighted the success of Glass Window and Virgin Records in introducing Rylo and helping develop this new partnership which is one of many the company has secured in recent times.

SIDE STAGE VENTURES LAUNCHES EARLY-STAGE FUND: Highly respected Australian entrepreneur, business executive, and artist manager Jaddan Comerford, along with his Side Stage Ventures partners, has unveiled a new fund that will champion Australia’s early-stage entrepreneurial innovators. The fund has secured an initial close of $15 million (USD), led by Ben Grabiner and Markus Kahlbetzer, in collaboration with Linktree founders Alex and Anthony Zaccaria, Tractor Ventures co-founder Matt Allen, and Comerford himself. The fund addresses a gap in the market, focusing on seed-stage investments, providing $500,000 investments to promising Australian founders, and cultivating a supportive community for growth and scaling. Side Stage Ventures, established amidst the pandemic in 2020, has already invested substantially in startups worldwide. Comerford, who is a driving force behind Side Stage Ventures, has underscored his passion for nurturing talent, both in music and entrepreneurship.

ROUND HILL MUSIC ACQUIRES REMAINDER OF BIG LOUD SHIRT CATALOG: Round Hill Music has solidified its ownership of Big Loud Shirt‘s music publishing rights by acquiring the remaining share, bringing its ownership to 100%. This move follows Round Hill’s previous acquisition of a share in Big Loud Shirt’s catalog in 2014. Additionally, Round Hill has obtained 50% of songwriter/producer Craig Wiseman’s writer’s income streams – Wiseman is the Founder & Owner of Big Loud Shirt. The extensive Big Loud Shirt catalog boasts over 1,200 songs, including hits by artists like Blake Shelton, Carrie Underwood, Dierks Bentley, and Tim McGraw. This acquisition expands Round Hill’s portfolio, aligning with their existing interests in iconic tracks such as McGraw’s “Live Like You Were Dying,” Underwood’s “Before He Cheats” and “Blown Away,” and George Strait’s “I Saw God Today.” This deal also increases Round Hill’s presence in the country music market, which accounted for 11% of its portfolio by the end of 2022.

INFLUENCER AGENGY NAMES EXECUTIVE PROMOTIONS: VRTCL, an influencer and viral marketing agency that drives content-first narratives for brands, music, and celebrity clients, has promoted Imani “Mango” Lewis to Director of Music and Jenn Rilloraza to Director of Brands & Content. Together, Lewis and Rilloraza will work closely with influencers and artists to create collaborative content. In her new role, Imani will lead the overall strategy and operations of the music and social teams, interacting with artist management teams, label A&R’s and social media directors. Lewis’ promotion comes on the heels of the successful Lil Durk “All My Life” influencer campaign, which she spearheaded. As a result, the song landed on TikTok’s Top Track charts for three weeks in a row. Rilloraza will continue to focus on developing the company’s overall strategy, operations, and brand for the content team, developing authentic content on behalf of some of the world’s biggest brands. Prior to her current role, Jenn, who is a former Create Music intern, quarterbacked VRTCL TikTok brand campaigns for MrBeast Burger, Insomniac Events, (RED) x Beats by Dre, Nectar Hard Seltzers, Sanzo Sparkling Water, Cardi B’s Whipshots, Samsung, Dr. Pepper, JuneShine Hard Kombucha and Roblox. Rilloraza previously served as a marketing coordinator at Prodigy Artists working in dance music and artist marketing.

MEXICAN STAR BELINDA SIGNS WITH WARNER MUSIC: Mexican star Belinda who boasts a diverse career in television, platforms, fashion, and music with over 17 million followers on Instagram has partnered with Warner Music Latina (WML). Alejandro Duque, President of Warner Music Latina, stated “We are honored to welcome Belinda, one of the most important artists in Latin pop music, to our WML family. Her undeniable talent, versatility, and dedication to her art make her a unique and exceptional artist. We are excited to accompany her on this new stage of her career, confident that, together, we will reach new horizons and make history in her return to music.” Belinda’s successes, including songs such as “Dopamina,” “Luz sin Gravedad,” “Egoísta,” “Bella Traición,” and “En la Obscuridad,” showcase the eclectic style that she has honed over the years. With four studio albums released, and numerous collaborations with artists such as Pitbull, Los Ángeles Azules, Ana Mena, Abraham Mateo, and Steve Aoki, Belinda has confidently positioned herself across various musical genres. In the coming months, Belinda will focus on recording new music and pursuing more creative projects, which she will soon unveil.

THE HOOSIERS INK PUBLISHING AND DISTRO DEAL: Downtown Music has unveiled a partnership with The Hoosiers, which is comprised of a publishing deal with Downtown Music Publishing (DMP) and a distribution agreement with Downtown-owned Fuga via Crab Race Ltd. As the band marks their 20th anniversary, the celebration is amplified by their upcoming fifth album Confidence, which is poised for a September release. Rising to prominence with chart-topping debut The Trick To Life, featuring hits like “Worried About Ray” and “Goodbye Mr. A,” The Hoosiers’ return is anticipated by fans locally in the UK and internationally.

BUCKS MUSIC GROUP UNVEILS DEAL WITH MURDO MITCHELL: Bucks Music Group has announced a partnership with Glasgow, Scotland’s rising star Murdo Mitchell. Having recently released his debut album Aztec Jewel, Mitchell has garnered attention across the UK and beyond. The singer/songwriter is represented by Pick & Mix Management and X-ray Touring. A new beginning has begun for Mitchell as he joins forces with Sony Music Norway/Drabant, with upcoming new music releases and live performances later this year. Sarah Liversedge Platz, Director A&R, Bucks Music stated, “We’re excited about Mitchell’s addition to our roster, and we’re amazed by his undeniable talent. Bucks A&R Rhiannon Bramley also echoed the singing and Platz’s sentiment.

YOTO PARTNERS WITH UNIVERSAL MUSIC GROUP: Yoto, the innovative audio platform for kids, has partnered with Universal Music Group (UMG). The collaboration marks an industry first, ushering iconic music titles and artists from UMG’s extensive catalog into the realm of children’s audio experiences. Yoto’s focus on fostering independence and exploration in young minds allows children as young as three to curate their musical journey. Founded in 2020 by digital music pioneers Ben Drury and Filip Denker, Yoto champions Montessori education principles and delivers a screen-free solution for children’s audio content. With a library boasting over 1,000 audiobooks, activities, and music, Yoto enhances children’s development and curiosity. The recent launch of Yoto’s 3rd Generation Player in June 2023, with enhanced immersive stereo sound, further amplifies its appeal. The partnership with UMG commences with Queen’s Greatest Hits: Volume 1, followed by releases from revered artists like Bob Marley & The Wailers, along with labels like Motown Records and Disney Music Group. These Yoto Cards will be accessible through various platforms, making quality music education accessible globally.

FRENCH MONTANA PARTNERS WITH GAMMA: French Montana has announced a collaboration with Gamma, a company known for its multi-disciplinary approach to entertainment. French Montana’s latest single, “Good Summer,” marks the beginning of this partnership. Gamma’s executive leadership has a longstanding connection with the Moroccan/American rapper. With a remarkable track record of 40 billion streams, French Montana’s career has spanned both major labels like Epic and Interscope and independent endeavors such as working with Empire. The recent announcement stated that French Montana declined a $20 million major label offer to remain independent, instead opting to partner with Gamma and its distribution arm Vydia. The recent deal was brokered with the support of Larry Jackson, Co-Founder & CEO, Gamma.

LEE SUGAR LANDS DEAL WITH [PIAS]: Sydney, Australian-based alt-pop artist Lee Sugar has joined [PIAS], signing a global deal with the independent music powerhouse. The announcement coincides with the release of his new single “Sunshine” and its self-directed music video. Sophie Brown, A&R, and Marketing Manager at [PIAS] Australia, helped with facilitating the deal. Having debuted a year ago with the chill-out R&B track “Cuckoo,” Sugar has since garnered attention from triple j Unearthed and secured triple j airplay. With a growing discography, Sugar has shared the stage with artists like Milan Ring and Daste and showcased at Bigsound 2022. [PIAS], founded in Belgium in 1982, has been a prominent indie presence for over four decades, and its Australian branch was established through the acquisition of Inertia Music in 2017.

REEL MUZIK WERKS SIGNS DEAL WITH JENNIFER ADAN: Songwriter Jennifer Adan has inked an administrative and publishing agreement with Reel Muzik Werks. The deal not only encompasses her future songs but also extends to her existing catalog. Adan’s track record includes the Platinum-certified, two-week No.1 sensation “She Wouldn’t Be Gone” by Blake Shelton, as well as the track “Don’t Come Home,” featured on MTV’s The Real World: San Diego. Notably, her collaborative abilities shined on “Metamorphosis,” a composition showcased on Grey’s Anatomy.

NEED TO MAKE CONTACT, SEND NEWS AND NEW MUSIC RELEASES?: If you have any A&R, publishing, technology, agent/promoter, international radio, management, new media or film/TV music supervisor news you’d like to share with A&R Worldwide, or need to respond to information published in the weekly newsletter please E–mail it to the attention of Sat Bisla at sat@anrworldwide.com. Also, all demos and new music releases should be sent as STREAMING LINKS ONLY to info@anrworldwide.com.
